unnormalised: ## Builder Reviews: Why are they so important, yaar?
normalised: ## Builder Reviews: Why are they so important, yaar?

unnormalised: Hey everyone, thinking of investing in a new property, maybe a flat in Gurgaon or a villa in Bangalore? The most important thing you can do *before* signing on the dotted line is to check the builder's reviews! Seriously.
normalised: Hey everyone, thinking of investing in a new property, maybe a flat in Gurgaon or a villa in Bangalore? The most important thing you can do *before* signing on the dotted line is to check the builder's reviews! Seriously.

unnormalised: I learned this the hard way. Back in 2018, I was super excited to book an apartment with a "reputed" builder in Noida. Sounded great in the brochure, amazing location near Amity University, promised possession by Dec 2019. But I skipped properly checking reviews. Huge mistake! Turns out, the builder had a history of delayed projects, shady dealings, and compromising on quality. Now, it's 2024 and still waiting.
normalised: I learned this the hard way. Back in two thousand and eighteen, I was super excited to book an apartment with a "reputed" builder in Noida. Sounded great in the brochure, amazing location near Amity University, promised possession by December two thousand and nineteen. But I skipped properly checking reviews. Huge mistake! Turns out, the builder had a history of delayed projects, shady dealings, and compromising on quality. Now, it's two thousand and twenty four and still waiting.

unnormalised: Think of it like this: You wouldn't buy mithai from a halwai who everyone says gives stomach aches, right? Same logic!
normalised: Think of it like this: You wouldn't buy mithai from a halwai who everyone says gives stomach aches, right? Same logic!

unnormalised: Builder reviews can give you insights into:
normalised: Builder reviews can give you insights into:

unnormalised: *   Construction quality (no one wants leaky ceilings after paying crores!)
normalised: * Construction quality (no one wants leaky ceilings after paying crores!)
* On-time delivery (remember my December two thousand and nineteen debacle?)

unnormalised: *   Hidden costs (Rs. 50,000 extra for what now?)
normalised: * Hidden costs (rupees fifty thousand extra for what now?)

unnormalised: *   Customer service (imagine calling them at 03:00 AM because of a burst pipe and getting no response)
normalised: * Customer service (imagine calling them at three A M because of a burst pipe and getting no response)

unnormalised: Websites like Magicbricks, 99acres, and even Google Reviews have sections dedicated to builder reviews. Also, talk to people already living in the builder's previous projects. Ask around in your network. Even a quick chat with your Sharmaji from IIT Delhi could save you a lot of headache. Don’t just rely on what the sales guy tells you at 11:00 hrs during the site visit. Due diligence is key, friends! Especially before parting with your hard-earned Lakshmi.
